required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY3471851 in Adults With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Phase 2 Study of LY3471851 (NKTR-358) in Adults With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to see if the study drug LY3471851 (NKTR-358) is safe and effective in adults with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).

detailed_description.textblock: LY3471851 is a potential first-in-class therapeutic that may address an underlying immune system imbalance in people with many autoimmune conditions. It targets the interleukin (IL-2) receptor complex in the body in order to stimulate proliferation of inhibitory immune cells known as regulatory T cells. By activating these cells, LY3471851 may act to bring the immune system back into balance.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Achieve a ≥4 Point Reduction in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index (SLEDAI) 2000 (2K) Score
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Achieve a ≥4 Point Reduction in SLEDAI-2K Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Achieve British Isles Lupus Assessment Group (BILAG) Based Composite Lupus Assessment (BICLA) Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Achieve BICLA Response

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Achieve Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Responder Index 4 (SRI-4) Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Achieve SRI-4 Response

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Achieve Lupus Low Disease Activity State (LLDAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Achieve LLDAS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a clinical diagnosis of SLE at least 24 weeks prior to screening.
- Have documentation of having met at least 4 of 11 Revised Criteria for Classification of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus according to the 1997 Update of the 1982 American College of Rheumatology (ACR) criteria for classification of SLE prior to randomization.
- Have a positive antinuclear antibody (ANA) (titer ≥1:80) and/or a positive anti-double-stranded deoxyribonucleic acid (dsDNA), and/or a positive anti-Smith (anti-Sm) as assessed by a central laboratory during screening.
- Have a total Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index 2000 (SLEDAI-2K) score ≥6 during screening.
- Have a clinical SLEDAI-2K score ≥4 at randomization.
- Have active arthritis and/or active rash.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have severe active lupus nephritis.
- Have active central nervous system (CNS) lupus.
- Have a history or presence of cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, gastrointestinal, endocrine, hematological, neurological, or neuropsychiatric disorders or any other serious and/or unstable illness that, in the opinion of the investigator, could constitute an unacceptable risk when taking investigational product or interfere with the interpretation of data.
- Have a current or recent clinically serious viral, bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection.

link.description: A Study of LY3471851 in Adults With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) (ISLAND-SLE)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
